page.title: 01BUGTHORPE VILLAGE
page.content: There are one hundred and eleven people living in Bugthorpe including thirteen children. The village hall is used as a youth club on Monday evenings and for whist drives every Wednesday.The hall is also the village War Memorial. Two builders and a plumber work from the village.There is a shop which is also the Post Office.Three mobile shops visit the village,these are a butcher(once a week) a fishmonger (once) and a breadman (three times). There are thirty nine houses in the village,all but four council houses and one private house are owned by Halifax Estates. There is a very limited bus service and a telephone box.
